info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:14PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 145 PM MDT... At 113 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ribera, or 15 miles southwest of Las Vegas, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Tecolote, Storrie Lake State Park, Sapello, Ribera, Romeroville, Montezuma, El Porvenir, San Geronimo, and Mineral Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 318 and 329, and between Mile Markers 334 and 356. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 3. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 94 near Mile Marker 1. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 12, and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
